intro: Succisa pratensis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
